listing.description: A two bedroom ground floor apartment in Walthamstow's signature Warner style with a dedicated front door and section of rear garden. It's all located on the borders of Lloyd Park, and its open green spaces, landscaped gardens, cafes and courts. Walthamstow Central is just one mile away on foot.Not an inch of space is wasted thanks to the classic Warner design, with a long central corridor, two good sized bedrooms and plenty of fitted storage. Design and Decor is smart and modern throughout, with original timber floorboards underfoot in the first bedroom.If you lived here...You'll have Lloyd Park right on your doorstep, one of Walthamstow's Crown Jewels it's not just a beautiful space but also plays host to all manner of sports clubs and classes, as well as regular events like Grillstock and the Walthamstow Garden Party. There's also the famous William Morris Gallery.Inside you have two good sized bedrooms ??? each over 110 square feet plus a bright, airy 120 square foot front lounge and the long central corridor has wooden flooring underfoot.Stroll through Lloyd Park and you come to Hoe Street, Walthamstow's main thoroughfare with plenty of independent shops, bars, pubs, cafes and restaurants. Try brunch at the SoDo Pizza Cafe or catch a show at Ye Olde Rose & Crown theatre pub. Further down you have Walthamstow Central station, with direct 20 minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street.What else?- At 115 years, the lease won't cause you any problems.- The garden is a beautifully maintained mixture of patio, lush lawn and beds, with plenty of screening greenery.- For your new local we have to recommend The Bell, a great gastropub just the other side of Lloyd Park.Lounge (3.3m x 3.2m (10'9" x 10'5"))Kitchen (2.6m x 2.4m (8'6" x 7'10"))Bedroom (3.4m x 3.2m (11'1" x 10'5"))Bedroom (3.5m x 3.4m (11'5" x 11'1"))Bathroom (2.6m x 1.6m (8'6" x 5'2"))Hallway (6.7m x 1.9m (21'11" x 6'2"))WcA word from the owner....."We loved the feel of the flat from the outset with its high ceilings and large windows giving a light and spacious feeling, such a contrast to a typical flat! During our four years here we've developed the garden. Creating a lovely outlook from the lounge onto roses at the front and a secluded sitting out area at the back. Walthamstow has a great community feel and we'll really miss the area. A few minutes away from the flat is the entrance to Lloyd park. Many enjoyable weekends have been spent with a coffee at the William Morris Gallery or taking photos around the historic gardens. The Bell pub just the other side of the park also does a great Sunday roast for those winter days and has a large sunny beer garden."
listing.short_description:
A two bedroom ground floor apartment in Walthamstow's signature Warner style with a dedicated front door and section of rear garden. It's all located on the borders of Lloyd Park, and its open green spaces, landscaped gardens, cafes and courts. Walthamstow Central is just one mile away on foot. Not an inch of space is wasted thanks to the classic Warner design, with a long central corridor, two good sized bedrooms and plenty of fitted storage. Design and Decor is smart and modern throughout, with original timber floorboards underfoot in the first bedroom.

If you lived here... You'll have Lloyd Park right on your doorstep, one of Walthamstow's Crown Jewels it's not just a beautiful space but also plays host to all manner of sports clubs and classes, as well as regular events like Grillstock and the Walthamstow Garden Party. There's also the famous William Morris Gallery. Inside you have two good sized bedrooms ??? each over 110 square feet plus a bright, airy 120 square foot front lounge and the long central corridor has wooden flooring underfoot. Stroll through Lloyd Park and you come to Hoe Street, Walthamstow's main thoroughfare with plenty of independent shops, bars, pubs, cafes and restaurants. Try brunch at the SoDo Pizza Cafe or catch a show at Ye Olde Rose & Crown theatre pub. Further down you have Walthamstow Central station, with direct 20 minute runs to Oxford Circus and Liverpool Street. What else? - At 115 years, the lease won't cause you any problems. - The garden is a beautifully maintained mixture of patio, lush lawn and beds, with plenty of screening greenery. - For your new local we have to recommend The Bell, a great gastropub just the other side of Lloyd Park.

Lounge (3.3m x 3.2m (10'9" x 10'5"))

Kitchen (2.6m x 2.4m (8'6" x 7'10"))

Bedroom (3.4m x 3.2m (11'1" x 10'5"))

Bedroom (3.5m x 3.4m (11'5" x 11'1"))

Bathroom (2.6m x 1.6m (8'6" x 5'2"))

Hallway (6.7m x 1.9m (21'11" x 6'2"))

Wc

A word from the owner..... "We loved the feel of the flat from the outset with its high ceilings and large windows giving a light and spacious feeling, such a contrast to a typical flat! During our four years here we've developed the garden. Creating a lovely outlook from the lounge onto roses at the front and a secluded sitting out area at the back. Walthamstow has a great community feel and we'll really miss the area. A few minutes away from the flat is the entrance to Lloyd park. Many enjoyable weekends have been spent with a coffee at the William Morris Gallery or taking photos around the historic gardens. The Bell pub just the other side of the park also does a great Sunday roast for those winter days and has a large sunny beer garden."

listing.description: A delightful and well presented 3 bedroom split level apartment with private terrace in the centre of West Wickham.The property is offered on a chain free basis and benefits from double glazed windows and doors, gas fired central heating with a 'Worcester bosch' boiler a long lease and very low outgoings.Set over two floors the good sized kitchen diner offers ample space for table and chairs along with a range of fully fitted wall and base units, integrated oven and hob with extractor canopy. The sitting room is well proportioned with???double glazed leaded lights and door to the inner hall which leads to the 3rd bedroom and bathroom along with stairs to the top floor and two further bedrooms. The main bedroom offers plenty of storage with built in wardrobe and storage. Bedroom two also offers storage space and has a bay area which is ideal for a desk etc.West Wickham train station is within easy walking distance and being centrally located (above commercial premises) you are on the door step of the High Street with its array of shops including a large Sainsburys and Boots chemist, restaurants etc.This property has some unusual character features and from a security conscious there is a coded wrought iron gate to and from the terrace offering complete peace of mind.Call the vendors sole agents aegis now for an appointment to view and for more information.Room dimensions:Steps to 1st floor gate (security code access)Double glazed door to:Kitchen/diner: 12'4 x 9 door to flat and access to patio areaSitting room: 16'5 x 9'5 windows to the frontInner hall with stairs (velux window)Bathroom: 6'6 x 6'9Bed 3: 10' x 7'2Bed 1: 11'5 max x 10'4 feature bay window to frontBed 2: 11'4 x 9'4 into eaves built in wardrobes and eaves storage 2 velux windowsPrivate Terrace (decked) 17' x 12Tenure: Long Leasehold

listing.description: Guide price ??550,000 - ??575,000Tucked away in an established, sought-after cul-de-sac is this three bedroom semi detached home, situated on an impressive plot, with a magnificent garden measuring approximately 160ft. The property is located with access to Orpington and Petts Wood railway stations, serving several London termini, with fast trains into London Bridge taking approximately 17 minutes. The highly regarded Perry Hall and Crofton Primary Schools can also be found locally.Relax in the living area while enjoying views of the colourful, established garden - an aspect also enjoyed by the kitchen, dining and rear bedroom. The ground floor comprises a hallway, a modern fitted kitchen, and a through lounge and dining room with sliding doors which makes it easy to take advantage of al fresco dining on the patio.The first floor comprises three well proportioned bedrooms, two having the benefit of fitted wardrobes, and a family bathroom inclusive of bath and separate shower. The property is double-glazed and benefits from gas central heating.To the rear of the property is the aforementioned garden. Full of mature shrubbery and with an immaculate lawn the garden needs to be seen in person to be truly appreciated.To the front is off street parking and a single garage - extended to the rear to accommodate domestic appliances and a work station. There is also a garden shed and greenhouse.Though immaculately maintained and ready to move in and enjoy there is still the opportunity to modernize or extend stpp. One thing is for sure, if you value peace and quiet and crave peace of mind, do not delay your visit.

listing.description: An Expansive Family Home in Walthamstow Village.This huge three/four bedroom property is a great example of a Victorian semi-detached home in Walthamstow. Located in E17's village area, you are just a hop skip and jump away from the amenities of Orford Road where you can stock up on wine at In Vino Veritas, enjoy delicious tapas, dine in Eat17 or stop for a drink in the beer garden of The Village or The Queen???s Arms. Or just moments around the corner you are at the Bakers Arms were you can get a great breakfast on the weekend at Johnston's or a cup of coffee and slice of cake at The Hornbeam Cafe. You also have Wingfield Park just a short stroll away which is perfect on a sunny day for letting the children run off some steam.Living Here...Stepping up to the property it boasts being semi-detached and side access which is perfect for taking the bikes or children round the back of the house after a Sunday morning ride in the forest (or just around the village). Walking through the entrance hall it leads into the first bay fronted through lounge which is a great entertaining space, being 25' long i'm sure your be able to fit the whole family in for a gathering. Stepping into the next expansive room you can just imagine Christmas dinner, one big table with the big turkey centre piece, and you will still have space for a sofa to lounge in after you have stuffed yourself with all the trimmings. Moving on beyond the sliding doors you have a fitted kitchen, followed by a conservatory. Next to the sliding doors, the door leads to a utility room and shower room behind. Moving on up to the first floor there are four big double bedrooms and family bathroom. Another step up you will find a loft room, a great space for storage, or potentially getting the drum-kit up there and making some music. The property can also be extended further (if you wanted to make the home bigger?) by a dormer conversion to the loft stpp. Outside in the approx. 40' garden with it's South facing aspect and workshop can you ask for much more?. The property has great potential for any type of buyer.In This Area - By Walthamstow DiaryBarker???s Arms is named after the pub of the same name which stood on the junction of Lea Bridge Road and Hoe Street. The building survives but the pub has long since closed. Happily, the Baker???s Alms Houses which the pub was named after still survive. The Alms houses can be found just around the corner on Lea Bridge Road. Built by the Master Bakers Benevolent institution in 1857, they are a grand architectural reminder of times past. On the other side of Lea Bridge Road you???ll find the King William IV pub, which is also home to Brodies Brewery. If you like beer, pay a visit to their annual Easter event, the Bunny Basher, though you might want to pre-warn your liver. Further up Hoe Street is the incredible Hornbeam Caf??, a great spot to enjoy fresh, locally produced food. The Hornbeam also host live music and film nights. This end of Hoe Street links Walthamstow to Leyton and has good transport links. There???s a good mix of properties here, and if you like to keep fit, this is the place for you. Leyton Gym and Leisure lagoon (complete with water slides) is just around the corner.Dimensions:EntranceVia front door leading into:Entrance PorchFurther door leading into:Entrance HallwayStaircase leading to first floor. Located in E17's village area, you are just a hop skip and jump away from the amenities of Orford Road where you can stock up on wine at In Vino Veritas, enjoy delicious tapas, dine in Eat17 or stop for a drink in the beer garden of The Village or The Queen???s Arms. Or just moments around the corner you are at the Bakers Arms were you can get a great breakfast on the weekend at Johnston's or a cup of coffee and slice of cake at The Hornbeam Cafe. You also have Wingfield Park just a short stroll away which is perfect on a sunny day for letting the children run off some steam.

Living Here...

Stepping up to the property it boasts being semi-detached and side access which is perfect for taking the bikes or children round the back of the house after a Sunday morning ride in the forest (or just around the village). Walking through the entrance hall it leads into the first bay fronted through lounge which is a great entertaining space, being 25' long i'm sure your be able to fit the whole family in for a gathering. Moving on beyond the sliding doors you have a fitted kitchen, followed by a conservatory. Next to the sliding doors, the door leads to a utility room and shower room behind. Another step up you will find a loft room, a great space for storage, or potentially getting the drum-kit up there and making some music. The property can also be extended further (if you wanted to make the home bigger?) by a dormer conversion to the loft stpp. Outside in the approx. 40' garden with it's South facing aspect and workshop can you ask for much more?. The property has great potential for any type of buyer.

In This Area - By Walthamstow Diary

Barker???s Arms is named after the pub of the same name which stood on the junction of Lea Bridge Road and Hoe Street. The building survives but the pub has long since closed. Happily, the Baker???s Alms Houses which the pub was named after still survive. The Alms houses can be found just around the corner on Lea Bridge Road. Built by the Master Bakers Benevolent institution in 1857, they are a grand architectural reminder of times past. On the other side of Lea Bridge Road you???ll find the King William IV pub, which is also home to Brodies Brewery. If you like beer, pay a visit to their annual Easter event, the Bunny Basher, though you might want to pre-warn your liver. Further up Hoe Street is the incredible Hornbeam Caf??, a great spot to enjoy fresh, locally produced food. The Hornbeam also host live music and film nights. This end of Hoe Street links Walthamstow to Leyton and has good transport links. There???s a good mix of properties here, and if you like to keep fit, this is the place for you. Leyton Gym and Leisure lagoon (complete with water slides) is just around the corner.

listing.description: At over 700 sq ft, with balcony, this sumptuous two bedroom, two bathroom apartment is set in the prestigious Cavalier House development located a short distance from Ealing Broadway town centre. Each flat within the development has an allocated off-street parking space and there is the award winning gym with spa and swim facilities located in the basement of the development.Cavalier House built circa 2006 by the Comer Brothers development company is well established on the Ealing sky-line and offers beautifully appointed apartments in a central location. This apartment is located on the first floor and has easy access to the resident only garden.These apartments were built to aim to the quality end of the residential market, with good size entertaining space, 24 hour concierge desk and swimming pool in the ground floor all lending itself to the type of buyer who seeks security, location and grand living.Ealing Broadway is undergoing something of a transformation itself as a Town Centre with the Dickens Yard development nearing completion just moments and this will ensure a modern, friendly town centre environment just moments from this property.From 2018/19 the Station will be transformed into a &145;Crossrail&146; appointed station which will serve the new &145;Elizabeth Line&146;. This will ensure fast and convenient access to Bond St and Canary Wharf amongst other stops while in the comfort of a large carriage carrying double the number of commuters of a normal tube carriage. According to Transport for London, journey to Bond St from Ealing Broadway station will be 11 minutes after the introduction of &145;Crossrail&146;.For commuting into the City you are very close to Ealing Broadway station. A station that provides current access through Central, District lines to the centre of London in addition to overground services to Paddington and also the Heathrow.Please call Go View London for your appointment to view on .

listing.description: Neptune Homes are delighted to offer for sale this three bedroom end of terrace family home. The property comprises of a front reception room, good sized rear dining room opening onto the hand crafted fitted kitchen. To the first floor are three bedrooms and a family bathroom. This property also offers a rear walled garden with a scope to extend (stpp). Further benefits include gas central heating and wooden flooring with some original features. A bright and spacious house, located in a quiet pedestrianised cul-de-sac within a short walking distance of Turnpike Lane.Local primary schools include Belmont Junior School which was rated Outstanding by Ofsted in its last report. There are also some very nice parks within walking distance and one of these happens to be the award winning Lordship Recreation Ground which has lots of facilities as well as a large cycle track.Turnpike Lane is a popular and mainly residential area of North London just north of Crouch End. It has become a very trendy area with a large selection of cafes, bars and restaurants plus excellent transport connections.Within the catchment area of several local schools plus there is a good selection of parks within walking distance. listing.description: A wonderful semi-detached modern family house with two double bedrooms and quietly tucked away in what feels like a semi-rural location, yet giving nearby access to Hampton village with its railway station and shops, bars and restaurants. Carlisle Park and Hampton common are both close by and there is good access to sought-after local schools. An entrance porch leads to the spacious and l-shaped reception room with separate sitting and dining areas. The kitchen is front aspect and has a range of fitted units with space for appliances. The conservatory provides an additional reception room and leads to the garden, as well as providing access to the attached garage. Upstairs there are two good sized double bedrooms and the master bedroom has a built in wardrobe. There is a family shower room and W.C with a modern fitted suite. There is double glazing and gas central heating. Outside there is a lovely private rear garden with lawned and patio areas and tree, flower and shrub borders. There is an attached garage with its own drive and an off street parking space, and there are further unallocated residents and visitor???s parking spaces.

listing.description: This incredible house is one of only six houses built in the Bauhaus style, situated on Herondale Avenue, one of Wandsworth's premier residential streets. This sale represents a truly rare opportunity to buy one of these landmark houses that boasts incredible lateral space, width of plot and an alternative to the more common Victorian/ Edwardian architecture. The current owners have gone to great lengths to retain many of the original features, which will appeal to anyone with an interest in design and architecture.One of the most striking features as you enter the property, is the shear width of plot that measures in excess of 44ft across. To put this into context, the plot could easily accommodate two fairly significant Victorian houses, side by side.The sense of space is evident as soon as you walk through the front door to the stunning entrance hall, with its original panelling and open tread staircase. No less than four reception rooms lead from the entrance hall, one of which is open plan to the kitchen. There is direct access from two of the ground floor rooms to a superb south facing garden that measures in excess of 100 feet in length.Another feature that gives this house unique status is its pair of garages, that are situated at the end of the garden and accessed via Burntwood Grange. The opportunities for these garages are endless, from their original purpose as secure parking through to conversion to an annex, studio or playroom (subject to the usual consents).A spacious master bedroom can be found to the rear of the first floor with a luxurious en-suite bathroom and south facing balcony. Three further bedrooms and a family bathroom can also be found on the same level. The second-floor boasts two further good bedrooms, a shower room and a roof terrace. The roof terrace benefits from impressive far reaching views of the southwest London skyline and offers an excellent space for entertaining.There is plenty of scope for further development, if more space is required. The property also has off-street parking to the front, a landscaped front garden and side access.Herondale Avenue runs from Lyford Road to Ellerton Road. Wandsworth Common is at the eastern end of the road, so the amenities of Bellevue Road are within easy walking distance. Transport can be found at Wandsworth Common overground with its links into Victoria. The area is well known for its abundance of good state and private schools, subject to catchment and entrance each year.

listing.description: A beautifully presented split level two bedroom flat in between Herne Hill and Brixton. This property has been decorated to a modern standard throughout and comprises a separate modern kitchen to the front, adjacent to a light and airy large reception room with direct access to a private balcony, offering one of the best views available over the ever popular Brockwell Park. Upstairs sits a modern bathroom and two double bedrooms, with one having access to another private balcony boasting an extraordinary view of the city. Furthermore, the property benefits from having its own front door and ample storage. Meath House is set back from Dulwich Road; a Victorian terraced street, which is pleasing on the eye and located between Brixton and Herne Hill. The celebrated Herne Hill establishments are close-by and the restaurants and shops within the lauded Brixton Village are not far. Herne Hill station is a fourminute walk and Brixton station is a 12 minute walk in the other direction. Purchasers will have access to Canary Wharf in thirty seven minutes and Victoria within seventeen minutes, door to door. With Brockwell Park, Herne Hill???s pubs and restaurants and Brixton Village all on your doorstep, this property will appeal to purchasers who are contemplating moving to both areas.

listing.description: A well presented two bedroom garden flat in a Victorian purpose built house. The property comprises a light and airy reception room to the front with stripped wooden flooring and a feature fireplace. Adjacent lies two double bedrooms and to the rear is a bathroom and a separate kitchen with direct access to a secluded and quiet private garden. There is character throughout with wooden flooring, high ceilings and original wooden flooring. The property also has the added benefit of ample storage and its own front door. The flat is nestled in a popular residential pocket, highly sought after for its character, feel and proximity to Brixton, Streatham Hill and Clapham. Streatham Hill station is a fifteen minute walk with direct trains into Clapham Junction, Victoria and London Bridge. Within a fifteen minute walk you have the centre of Brixton and within sixteen minutes??? walk you reach Clapham Common tube station. On one hand you will everything that Brixton has to offer, from music venues and the culinary delights of Brixton Village, to large brand-shops and cracking transport links, first stop on the Victoria Line. Multiple buses run up and down Brixton Hill, whisking you down to the tube within a few minutes and fortunately this flat is a stone's throw from a local bus stop with buses coming and going every other minute. On the other hand you will have Clapham High Street and its multitude of restaurants and bars. There are excellent transport links with two Northern Line underground stations, Clapham High Street Station on the Overground and numerous bus routes to other areas of London. Brockwell Park and Clapham Common are both within walking distance and having the South Circular on your doorstep is perfect for anyone with a car. Chain free.

listing.description: A spacious four bedroom brick-fronted semi-detached house available for sale with no onward chain. Totalling 1377 sq ft / 127 sq m of flexible living accommodation, this blank canvas property could provide the perfect opportunity for a new owner seeking a house to modernise and create a long-term residence (s) to their own specification. Sought after features include a south-facing 76ft mature rear garden, three reception rooms, one of which can be used as a dinning room, WC and utility / kitchen area on the ground floor. Upstairs there are four well proportioned bedrooms, a shower room and access to a large attic space with potential to convert (stp). Marlow road is a quiet residential street and forms part of a toast rack of roads offering varying styles of period properties. Closest rail links are Birkbeck, Anerley and Norwood Junction, or multiple tram stations. EPC: G

listing.description: Pedder are delighted to announce the sale of this stunning share of freehold Victorian maisonette on the highly sought after Melbourne Grove, East Dulwich. The property has been finished to a high standard by the current owners and is in immaculate condition throughout comprising: Two large double bedrooms (one with en-suite), an eat-in kitchen, family bathroom and a fantastic large separate reception room. It offers fantastic storage with a substantial loft (that is convertible) and has the additional luxury of a private south facing garden. Melbourne Grove is ideally located in very close proximity to the amenities of the popular Lordship Lane. Dulwich Village is also close by with its excellent schools, Picture Gallery and golf course. Rail links to Central London are from East Dulwich which is a few minute's walk away and North Dulwich train station is nearby too. Viewings are strongly recommended for this fine property. EPC E

listing.description: A rare opportunity to acquire a mixed use freehold building on the renowned Columbia Road. The building is a two storey Victorian terrace comprising a self-contained ground floor retail unit and two independent 1 bedroom apartments. The residential element incorporates two self-contained one bedroom apartments, the first on the ground floor and second on the first floor. Both are very unique with intelligent design and use of space evident throughout.The ground floor consists of a spacious kitchen/dining area. Fully tiled and extended outwards, with pitched ceiling, skylighting and access opening to both the bedroom and bathroom. The kitchen offers an eclectic mix of old and new and adds real character and charm. The staircase to the first floor apartment opens into a homely reception room with wood flooring and a recently fitted open-plan kitchen. To the rear is a good sized double bedroom and on the upper split level is a smart shower room brilliantly created using some of the loft space. The reception is light and airy which looks out across Columbia Road itself and onto Ravenscroft Park.The ground floor retail unit has excellent frontage and high visibility with A1 use and is currently occupied by a successful bespoke jeweller.Columbia Road is famous as the home to the Sunday flower market but also offers an increasing number of quality eateries alongside renowned pubs The Royal Oak and Birdcage. There are numerous boutiques specialising in vintage and high end fashion and homewares. Broadway Market, the Shoreditch Triangle and Brick Lane are all within a short walk, as are Shoreditch High Street Overground, Hoxton Overground, Cambridge Heath Rail Station, Bethnal Green and Old Street Underground stations.

listing.description: A rare opportunity to acquire this recently built four bedroom townhouse set on this private development and presented in immaculate condition throughout. Developed by Taylor Wimpey this wonderful family home has many features and is arranged over three floors. To the ground floor there is a larger than average wide lounge with an added conservatory leading onto a stunning south facing garden. There is a front facing kitchen which has been elegantly designed featuring fitted units, appliances and plinth fan heating. To the first floor are two bedrooms with the master bedroom benefitting from an en suite shower room. On the second floor there are a further two double bedrooms and a three piece family bathroom. Bright and airy throughout this owner occupied home would suit all first time buyers looking in a prime residential area. The development is walking distance to the local leisure centre, the award winning Westbrook primary School as well as Heston community school and both Osterley and Hounslow West tube stations are within easy reach. Preliminary Charges (per dwelling) - ??250

Payable in full prior to negotiations commencing. If negotiations are

the costs of processing the application and referencing checks on documents
authenticity by an independent agency.

Right to Rent Charge (per dwelling) - ??25

We must check every occupant over 18 has the legal right to rent in the UK.

Inventory Check In/Schedule of Condition (per dwelling) - upwards of ??80 +
(inc. VAT) price on application

inventory/schedule of condition. The cost of this is dependent on the size
and content of property and is payable by the in going tenant. Prospective
tenants will be advised the cost at the outset of negotiations.

Short Let Fee (per dwelling) ??? From ??450

This fee applies to short term lettings only and covers the cost of
preparing an Agreement, an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

Under the terms of most tenancy agreements you will usually be required to
pay 1 month rent in advance prior to commencement of the tenancy.

Deposit ??? 6 weeks??? rent

protection service called Mydeposits and tenant deposits are held in line
with their terms and conditions. Further information can be found at their
website

Elder Street is a short walk from Bishopsgate, Liverpool Street Station and Spitalfields Market.DescriptionA period Georgian house with basement, ground, and two upper floors. Built in 1725 by William Goswell, this property was home to British painter Mark Gertler. The building benefits from a current B1 use with planning for a single family dwelling. listing.description: Taking the first steps on to the property ladder is an exciting time but choosing the right property is difficult as so many need work which then eats in to your budget and time.Well this apartment is the perfect first home because it has been tastefully refurbished by the current owners with a new modern kitchen and decorated throughout, you really do just need to unpack your boxes and start enjoying life here.From the moment you set foot in this property you get the feeling of space with a large lounge which is ideal for curling up in front of the TV after a long day at work and a separate kitchen which would not be out of place in many family houses.When its time for you to get some rest the bedroom just keeps on with the same theme of space with it being a large double room with lots of light streaming in, an ideal space to get a good nights sleep.The location is brilliant with it being on the 455 bus route which will get you to Wallington station in around 8 minutes and then in to London in around half an hour, so commuting is a breeze and means that you get to spend a few extra minutes in bed in the morning.Don???t miss out on this wonderful opportunity to take your first steps or maybe for an investment as a second property.What the Owner says:The transformation from when we first took ownership of this property is huge, we have really enjoyed living here and the biggest draw for us when we were viewing were the room sizes which we just couldn???t find in any other flat, although it needed some work we were willing to take that on because of the space it offered us.We hope the next owners enjoy the property even half as much as we have.The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: Searching for your dream home should be an exciting affair, however more often than not buyers tell me it is stressful and very time consuming! Finding a property to tick the two must haves, size and location is a tough chore but it needs to be done. That painful task could now be over as this superb home is a show stopper for all of the above!Your commute to work couldn???t be simpler living here, being so centrally located in Wallington, a brisk walk to the station in the morning could take you less than ten minutes, being just .4 of a mile away - imagine the extra time you could have hitting the snooze button!Often your lifestyle in a flat is dictated by the space you have and if you have enough room then inviting friends over for dinner is something you like to do, then the great news is that there's plenty of room here! The lounge is spacious enough to hold a dinner party in if you so desired. If dinner parties aren???t your thing and just a dinner for one in front of the TV is then how great would it be to catch up on all the latest soap operas whilst cooking yourself a nice healthy meal.What the Owner says:I looked at over 40 flats before I found this one. I had been looking at purpose built flats, which are really boxey and pokey, but the moment I walked into this one, I fell in love with it. I loved all the character of this property, I loved the period features and the high ceilings and wonderfully spacious rooms. What also attracted me was the commute into London is excellent and you can either travel by train from Wallington or Carshalton and be in London in no time.I am heartbroken to be leaving, there's a real sense of community which I will miss, all the shop owners know me! listing.description: Everyone is looking for the perfect home aren't they? You may be experiencing major problems in finding that there is just nothing on the market that meets your high standards. Now this is where we are going to make your day, nestled in a coveted residential location you will find this spacious house, sitting pride of place in a convenient road.Inside, the property has kept a lot of the original features and offers excellent proportions with wonderful features such as the bay window and a log burner, creating an ideal place to snuggle up with a good book in the colder months. A separate dining area waits for you towards the back of the property - excellent for when you entertain at one of your dinner parties!Furthermore, this house is certainly an excellent size for the period of build with fantastic space, like the well-proportioned kitchen area and a further room which is currently used as a playroom.On the first floor this house doesn't let you down with spacious dimensions throughout all the bedrooms and the bathroom being a modern space you will love relaxing in at the end of the day.So you have looked at other four bedroom houses but what are they missing? Somewhere to park! So what you have here is a driveway to leave the car on and walk into town. To top everything off the property is superbly located with schools, great amenities and a train station all only a short walk away.What the Owner says:We bought this house 13 years ago as we completely fell in love with the size of it. The minute we walked through the door, we were bowled over by the large rooms and high ceilings. It was and is an excellent location for schools and having 2 boys, this was important to us. They both went to the Avenue which is an incredibly sought after school. The location is also ideal for the town centre and the station is very easy for commuting especially as we have a driveway so can leave the car at home. Since living here, we have replaced the central heating system and had the windows replaced. We also re-decorated throughout. It's an amazing home for any family and I will certainly miss the convenience of living here.Room sizes:Entrance HallLounge 14'3 x 12'9 (4.35m x 3.89m)Dining Area 11'5 x 10'7 (3.48m x 3.23m)Kitchen Area 8'8 x 8'7 (2.64m x 2.62m)Play room 18'0 x 11'10 (5.49m x 3.61m)LandingBathroom 8'11 x 8'0 (2.72m x 2.44m)Bedroom 1 14'3 x 12'0 (4.35m x 3.66m)Bedroom 3 10'7 x 10'0 (3.23m x 3.05m)Bedroom 2 15'7 x 11'6 (4.75m x 3.51m)Bedroom 4 8'1 x 6'5 (2.47m x 1.96m)Separate ToiletDrivewayRear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: Every now and again a property becomes available which really is the pinnacle of its type. It is a rare event that seldom happens - but we are now able to offer you that opportunity.This home is unlike any other we currently have on the market, so having to compromise is no longer the issue.Inside, this gorgeous two bedroom split level apartment is offered to an unsurpassed level, the fantastic open plan lounge area will really impress your friends and family. It is surely a feature of the property, with so much space to relax in.The rest of the property does not disappoint with a spacious modern kitchen area to cook your favourite meals for your guests. As an extra bonus there is not just a family bathroom but also an en ??? suite off of the master bedroom. So no need to be late in the morning's anymore! Now this is where the property really excels ??? the master bedroom is quite possibly the largest bedroom we have ever seen in any apartment.On the outside, the location really doesn't get any better. Ever fancied a leafy but quiet South Sutton road?
